gml:Dictionary.gml:description: The type of an alternative geographic identifier (e.g., a name) of a location instance in a gazetteer.
gml:Dictionary.gml:name: DoD/IC Dictionary: GSIP Geographic Identifier Name Type Code Dictionary

gml:Definition.gml:description: The approved geographic name for a feature as determined in accordance with the naming policy of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN).
gml:Definition.gml:name: Approved

gml:Definition.gml:description: An English name that is in widespread usage for a feature that is located in a region where English is not the official language.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Conventional

gml:Definition.gml:description: A historical name for a feature that remains in the original (non-Latin/Roman) script.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Historical Original

gml:Definition.gml:description: A historical name for a feature that has been transliterated to the Latin/Roman script as necessary.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Historical Transliterated

gml:Definition.gml:description: The official local name for a feature that remains in the original (non-Latin/Roman) script and is approved by the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN).
gml:Definition.gml:name: Native Original

gml:Definition.gml:description: The official local name for a feature that has been transliterated to the Latin/Roman script as necessary and is approved by the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN).
gml:Definition.gml:name: Native Transliterated

gml:Definition.gml:description: A provisional name for a feature that remains in the original (non-Latin/Roman) script.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Provisional Native

gml:Definition.gml:description: A local name for a feature that remains in the original (non-Latin/Roman) script, where a native source for the name was either unavailable or nonexistant and a non-native source for the name was used instead and the resulting name could not be verified from a recent local official source.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Unverified Original
gml:Definition.gml:remarks: An unverified name is usually indicated in a gazetteer using the dagger symbol.

gml:Definition.gml:description: A local name for a feature that has been transliterated to the Latin/Roman script as necessary, where a native source for the name was either unavailable or nonexistant and a non-native source for the name was used instead and the resulting name could not be verified from a recent local official source.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Unverified Transliterated
gml:Definition.gml:remarks: An unverified name is usually indicated in a gazetteer using the dagger symbol.

gml:Definition.gml:description: A variant or alternate name for a feature that remains in the original (non-Latin/Roman) script.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Variant Original
gml:Definition.gml:remarks: For example, a former name, a name in local usage, alternate name spellings found in various sources, or a derived short name.

gml:Definition.gml:description: A variant or alternate name for a feature that has been transliterated to the Latin/Roman script as necessary.
gml:Definition.gml:name: Variant Transliterated
gml:Definition.gml:remarks: For example, a former name, a name in local usage, alternate name spellings found in various sources, or a derived short name.
